intro: Hieracium leucotrigonum, commonly known as the white-veined hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are yellow with white veins, and it produces small, hairy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Hieracium leucotrigonum is often found in temperate regions and is considered a minor weed in some agricultural settings.
